    Hi Sachin,

Thanx for your mail. The code which i am working on, some of it has already
been written and we are adding new packages to it also. As i wrote earlier,
i have never used Junit. What i want to know is, now suppose i add a new
class to an existing structure(say Abc.java),  now what do you suggest, that
should i write another class (TestAbc.java which will be same as the
class(Abc.java) but with certain assumptions where i try to write negative
tests so that my (abc.class) fails to pass the test.

And finally this TestAbc.java would be put in the package where testcases
are kept, and i will add this suite(TestAbc.java) to the main suite created
by someone else.
Am i clear ? if not please let me know, as i said i am new to writing
testcases, i need to know, how to start from the scratch.

Thanx and Regards,
Manpreet
  -----Original Message-----
  From: sachin gupta [mailto:sachin@...]
  Sent: Monday, March 19, 2001 1:02 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: RE: [junit] How to write testcases?


  Hello Manpreet,

  Your question is not clear to me...could you elaborate more  ? What do u
  mean by different structure ? Has the code already been written or you
have
  to write it etc...

  Regards,

  Sachin

  -----Original Message-----
  From: Manpreet [mailto:manpreet@...]
  Sent: Wednesday, November 08, 2000 2:51 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: [junit] How to write testcases?


  Hi all,

  At the begining, i would say pardon my ignorance.

  I am new to testing, i have written a few testcases(by looking at exsiting
  testcases) using JUnit, but i am still not confident, how and when to
write
  testcases. When should i make a different testcase and things like that.

  I subscribed to yahoo groups, and found all you intellectuals exchanging
  ideas on Junit which are certainly enlightening.

  My basic question is, Does writing testcases invlove making a different
  structure all together, i mean writing classes and then testing them
  independently from the code which is a part of my application.

  Please if you could write something about how should i proceed to write
  testcases, i would be obliged. Your replies will be highly appreciated.


  Thanx and Regards,
  Manpreet
